http://www.incgamers.com/2014/08/sims-4-forum-thread-tracks-78-missing-features

Sims 4 forum thread tracks 78+ missing features. Many of these are major.

Some of the restrictions that were made were made due to restrictions in the game engine, to which I say Bull. If the engine can't handle water, DON'T USE THAT ENGINE. Same with varied terrain(the terrain is flat). It's also missing Create a Style, something that has been very important to the Sims 3. It's 2014 and they can't handle color changing?

There's also no open world, no normal careers, and no open world. This is back down to The Sims 2, just with better graphics.

These engine restrictions are things that should be so simple to just MAKE A PART of the engine.

I will not be buying The Sims 4. I suggest you do the same. Don't waste your time with it.

Edited August 17, 2014 by sal_vager
Just don't buy any EA games.

I like the Sims, but I won't be buying Sims 4, EA got enough money out of me when I bought Sims 3 and four of the expansions.

Out of curiosity I looked into how much it would cost to buy all the Sims 3 expansions and it was a shock.

So many features that should be standard (weather, pets, spiral stairs, the majority of careers, etc.) are left to expansion packs that come to hundreds of pounds to buy.

EA goes way beyond greed into downright taking the ****

Just don't buy any EA games.

I suppose that would be a good idea, if I didn't used to support the studio behind the game itself (Maxis). But EA/maxis needs to feel defeat on this because of their cut corners. They need to feel Spore again here. Best hope is that The Sims 5 will begin development in a year.

And I really hope more avid Sims fans won't be blindsighted by the Shiny New Features enough to forget about the lost ones. I mean for Kraken's sake, If they used Unity they could have gotten a better result. As a matter of fact, I'm almost certain you could write a good Sims game in Unity if you were skilled enough. Maybe Maxis' hiatus after the official failure of Spore made the programmers a little rusty.
